data.title: Move ProneDamage from TakeCover trait to Warhead
data.body: More logical (some weapons should be better against prone infantry than others) and more flexible. Necessary for proper remake of TS, where weapons/warheads have varying efficiency versus prone infantry.

data.title: UI polish fixup
data.body: Adds the missing chrome.svg, and modifies the color picker circle to match the spawnpoints.

data.title: TD UI Polish
data.body: Fixes a few things that I felt could be improved.

data.title: Fixed closing slots not removing bots properly
data.body: as reported by @Squiggles211 in IRC a recent regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5115.

data.title: Add TD fade to/from black behavior to other mods.
data.body: #5234 introduced an annoying (to me) regression - the shellmap would flicker with one frame of the last game after aborting.  This fixes that issue and adds some nice polish to the other mods by porting the fade effect from TD to the other mods.

data.title: Disable maps with invalid rules
data.body:
This prevents the host from starting a game with a map that would crash during rules parsing.

![invalid-map](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/3006804/7c223726-de4f-11e3-824d-60aad056411b.png)

My original approach for this was to only validate custom maps (hence the fix for #4635), but preloading the rules for any map ended up being a better approach (useful for #3012).

data.title: Fixes lobby crash when joining MP game
data.body: Fixes #5351 and also properly shows connected client's spawn choice as a letter rather than a number.

data.title: Lobby crash when joining a MP game.


data.title: Tiberian Sun / RA2 tileset support
data.body:
This is a tracking bug for implementing the isometric heightmapped terrain used in TS and RA2.  This is the main prerequisite of our TS mod (#3363).

Requirements (roughly in the order they will need to be completed):
- [x] Introduce a new self-consistent 3d coordinate system. [#2887, #2917, #3433, #3434, #3531, #3583, #3586, #3592, #3861, #3886, #3887, #4371, plus probably others]
- [x] Unhardcode the infantry sub-cells to support 3 instead of 5 and adapt the perspective [#6100]
- [x] Add support for the tmp(TS) terrain tiles.
  - [x] Update the terrain renderer to support additional sprite types. [#4185]
  - [x] Add support for flat isometric tiles. [#4391]
  - [x] Add support for loading embedded overlay artwork (cliffs, slopes). [#6855]
  - [x] Add support for TS/RA2 style terrain variants. [#7757]
  - [x] Support parsing the depth data as additional sprite frames. [#7968]
- [x] Add support for orthographic (isometric) tile renderering.
  - [x] Support rectangular tiles with perspective. [#4391]
  - [x] Generalize the (currently hardcoded) relationship between cell and world coordinates.
    [#5629, #5757, #5758]
  - [x] Introduce isometric coordinate calculations. [#5778]
- [x] Add support for heightmaps and slope tiles.
  - [x] Extend Tileset format with fields for slope type and LAT relationships. [#6855]
  - [x] Extend Map format with a heightmap block. [#6901]
  - [x] Update cell -> world coordinate conversion to use the heightmap data. [#6901]
- [x] Write a TS/RA2 tileset.ini converter [#6708].
- [x] Write a new map editor that can render and place isometric tiles. [#8065]

data.title: Prepare a video preview of the new release
data.body:
It will take a couple of weeks to pull a final release build together, and so we should use this time to create a highlights video for the new features.  This strategy works well at driving social-media coverage of other projects like OpenMW.

If we can get some volunteers to do the narration and editing, then we can (and should - we will need to come up with a fair balance of features vs details across all the mods) plan out a script on IRC before we start.

data.title: RA cheat menu text corrections
data.body:
Renamed menu title to Cheats for consistency.
Added notion that it disables FoW as well to Disable Shroud cheat option (closes #5167).

data.title: Add a wiki page on upgrading mods / maps from the previous release
data.body:
The information in the changelog is not enough, and so we've had to walk the individual modders through the process on IRC - which isn't really good enough.

This should cover:
1. Modifying map.yaml (for mods)
2. Running `OpenRA.Utility.exe --upgrade-(mod|map)
3. Manual changes not covered by OpenRA.Utility.

data.title: Changed Combat WaterExplosion check to trigger below 0 as well
data.body: Fixes #4515.

data.title: Fixes inconsistency in reload times for Cnc Aircraft
data.body: Fixes the timing inconsistencies of #4755 but does not change the reload behavior of the Apache.  I will leave that to a later balance pr, but these changes provide the code necessary to facilitate the new behavior of making the reload counter reset when the actor fires a shot.  By default this behavior is turned off and it begins trying to reload once it no longer has max ammo, and does not reset the counter.

data.title: Remove the deprecation notice from the old Lua interface
data.body:
Fixes #5332.  The impending deprecation should probably still be
mentioned in the release notes.

data.title: Added a description to the pillbox
data.body: Ruined my git (again), so I made a new branch for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5325.

data.title: Use MSBuild to improve make.ps1's clean function
data.body: This makes make.ps1 also invoke MSBuild when performing a clean, to make cleaning a bit more effective.

data.title: Setup Travis CI to deploy GitHub releases
data.body: http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/deployment/releases/

data.title: Check proc's health before (un)docking. Fixes #5338
Removed TeslaInstantKills
data.body: as discussed in IRC with @ScottNZ. This is just a redundant hack trait.

data.title: Fixed Explodes never triggering
data.body: The `null` check below is important.

data.title: Explodes: does not work anymore
data.body: This seems to be a very recent regression.

data.title: Try to cache the build dependencies for Travis CI
data.body: http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching/

data.title: Fix encoding problems with ZipFile
data.body:
SharpZipLib seems to use default "OEM" encoding for decoding the file names in the archive. This may cause problems if the default OEM encoding (as reported by mono) do not installed in the system.

Mono seems to select the OEM code page based on system locale. On Russian system it is 866, on Greek - 737 (as reported by #5261). On some system these "OEM" code pages are not installed and the game crashes.

I think it's sufficient to use the default encoding for file names (as we hopefully don't store some non-ASCII filenames there).

This patch should fix bug #5261.

data.title: Add proper mod chooser images for RA and D2K
data.body: The new mod chooser is one of the headline features for the next release, and so we really should do better than the temporary placeholder art for RA and D2K.

data.title: Remove the old lua deprecation notice
data.body: The new lua implementation won't grow the bits it needs to properly obsolete the old API this release, so we should remove the (intentionally) annoying notice until there is something for the map authors to actually migrate to.

data.title: Mission fixes
Added the JUNGLE terrain
data.body: via http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=2880.msg19168#msg19168. The terrain tiles are binary compatible to TEMPERAT. We can use it for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5320.

data.title: Nuke/Ion Cannon actor targeting fix
data.body:
Fixes #5239 (at least it should).

The added customizability of the IonCannon support power was something I had already done about a week ago, it caused no problems during my tests and it shouldn't cause any regressions since all it does is un-hardcode some things.
